statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 18 \\ 0 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 33 \\ 12 \\ -24 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 18 \\ 0 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 33 \\ 12 \\ -24 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
